text: using AWS enables Health Direct to
deliver our services faster enabling
consumers and citizens of Australia to
find information that's more relevant
and more engaging and connect them with
the right points in the healthcare
system i'm Bruce Hafley i'm the chief
architect at Health Direct Australia
health Direct Australia is approximately
180 people we've grown very rapidly from
about 15 three years ago our object is
to try and help people to connect with
the health system and in the most
appropriate way we run the national
health services directory which is
increasingly now moving to also support
e- health addressing which will be a
critical part of our national
infrastructure and thereby underpin all
the messaging transactions between
clinicians using AWS allowed us to
continually increase the number of
consumers that we serve with very little
increase in cost which is very
attractive obviously being a government
funded taxpayer funded organization we
probably do a million unique impressions
across our websites in any given month
we have more than 30 million
transactions happening against our
service directory in every month we've
been on the AWS platform now for about 3
years and we're on our third AWS
architecture at this stage people are
still coming to grips with the security
model within the cloud we've been using
it for a long time we can see that AWS
affords us a level of security we would
never be able to achieve on our own and
not without great expense that shared
responsibility model um is very
important at keeping our costs low and
being able to offer a very secure
environment we make extensive use of EC2
continuous delivery is another place
where we've seen massive uh improvements
to our productivity
uh we at one stage could take up to a
few months to get a deployment right in
a production setting we now do multiple
deployments a day uh it's all automated
and we are looking to expand our use of
uh more of the AWS services we don't
always get things right the first time
um we make a lot of mistakes we have to
experiment and fail but because of the
flexibility that it offers it means that
we can evolve as we discover better ways
of doing things aws has provided us the
opportunity to reach more people more
quickly um we tend to be able to roll
out our services uh faster we're able to
use uh similar size teams working in
parallel to deliver multiple extensions
to our various products and that all
translates then into better health
opportunities for the consumers and
citizens of Australia
